articles.author: Gabriel Stargardter
articles.description: Michel Barnier, a veteran politician who was formerly the European Union's Brexit negotiator, will be the shortest serving prime minister in modern French history.
articles.title: Barnier expected to resign as France's festering political crisis rumbles on

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: South Korea's parliament formally introduced a motion on Thursday to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over a botched attempt to impose martial law, but his party vowed to oppose the move, throwing the process into doubt.
articles.title: South Korean ruling party to oppose Yoon's impeachment

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammed Salem
articles.description: The Israeli military killed at least 39 Palestinians in strikes across the Gaza Strip overnight, medics said on Thursday, including at least 20 in an attack that set ablaze tents sheltering displaced families in a crowded camp.
articles.title: Dozens dead in Israeli strikes on Gaza; Palestinians say Amnesty 'genocide' declaration comes too late

articles.author: Anne Kauranen
articles.description: A Russian man went on trial in Finland on Thursday on charges of committing war crimes while commanding a far-right paramilitary unit in eastern Ukraine a decade ago.
articles.title: Russian accused of war crimes in Ukraine goes on trial in Finland

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: New York police were searching on Thursday for the man who shot dead UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson in a brazen attack outside a Midtown Manhattan hotel and was last seen fleeing into Central Park.
articles.title: New York police hunt for man who killed UnitedHealth executive

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Syrian rebels said they had started pushing into Hama, a major city where pro-government forces backed by intense Russian air strikes are trying to stave off a new rebel victory and halt the insurgents' lightning advance.
articles.title: Syrian rebels say they have begun to enter crucial city of Hama

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Thursday he had imposed sanctions on Georgian former Prime Minister Bidzina Ivanishvili and some members of Georgia's government.
articles.title: Ukraine imposes sanctions on Ivanishvili, some members of Georgia government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Namibia's President-elect Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah pledged "radical shifts" to fix the country's high levels of poverty and unemployment, speaking on Thursday in her first press conference since winning last week's election.
articles.title: Namibia's president-elect pledges 'radical shifts' on poverty and unemployment

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan was indicted on Thursday on charges of inciting attacks against the military, a case stemming from deadly anti-government rallies led by his party last year.
articles.title: Pakistan's Imran Khan indicted on charges of inciting attacks against military

articles.author: Lais Morais
articles.description: When Rebeca Mendes became pregnant, she fought for the right to have an abortion in Brazil. The Supreme Court denied her request to allow it in 2017, so she flew to Colombia to terminate her pregnancy.
articles.title: Brazilian abortion activist had to go abroad to end pregnancy
